alert.note: Alert for Hill; Johnson; Montague; Tarrant; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 06 at 2:56PM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF I-35... * AFFECTED AREA...Along and west of Interstate 35. * TIMING...Late Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Near 70. * IMPACTS...Wildfires will have the potential to grow and spread rapidly. Any activities that can spark a wildfire should be avoided. Planned burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
